isis.stitle: CAB: 2000, 4000, AND 8000 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - DOOR LOCK ASSEMBLY

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to Figure 39for Items in parentheses.

The door lock cylinder (Item 7) is key coded to key switch on instrument panel so that one key operates both. If keys are lost or a replacement of lock cylinder is required, refer to KEY SWITCH CYLINDER, Remove and Install.

svcsubproc.title: Remove

step1.para: Remove hardware and trim, if so equipped. Refer to Hardware and Trim, Remove.
Disconnect rod end clip (Item 6) and detach lock control rod (Item 2) from door lock cylinder assembly (Item 7).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 43for Items in parentheses.

figure.caption: Figure 43. Pry Lock Cylinder Retainer Clip From Lock Cylinder Assembly

step1.para: Working through door access opening (Item 4), pry lock cylinder retainer clip (Item 2) from lock cylinder assembly (Item 3) with a small pry bar or screwdriver (Item 1).

note.para: Lock cylinder retainer clip can be removed without removing glass rear run channel. Channel removed in Figure 43for clarity

step1.para: Rotate lock cylinder assembly (Item 3) slightly and remove from door.

svcsubproc.title: Install
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 43for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Position lock cylinder assembly (Item 3) into door. Rotate lock assembly until it is positioned properly.
With lock cylinder (Item 3) in position, slide lock cylinder retainer clip (Item 2) onto cylinder.
Connect lock control rod (Item 2, Figure 39) to lock cylinder and secure with rod end clip (Item 6, Figure 39).
Install door hardware and trim, if so equipped. Refer to Hardware and Trim, Install.
